description: Continuing with their adventure at Greed Island, Gon and Killua train furiously under the guidance of Biscuit for better preparation at attempting the game. With their abilities vastly improving and the threat of player killers menacing Greed Island, Gon and company continue the game despite the dangers that they will face with the game activities and encounters with other players. Based on the manga by Togashi Yoshihiro.
synonyms: Hunter x Hunter: G I Final
ハンター×ハンター　G・I　Final

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Volleyball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of volleyball.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

name.native: ビスケット＝クルーガー
シャルナーク=リュウセイ

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Un4v5s8bgsVk9Xp)

A Japanese manga artist. He is most notable for having created [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/manga/30053/Yu-Yu-Hakusho/), for which he received the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1994, and [Hunter × Hunter](https://anilist.co/manga/30026/Hunter-x-Hunter/). In 1987, Togashi received the 34th Tezuka Award, the most influential new comic artist award in Japan, for his one-shot Buttobi Straight. 

Togashi is married to [Naoko Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/96946/), the creator of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/manga/30092/Sailor-Moon/). His brother, [Hideaki Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/174009/), is also a manga artist and has helped him work on his series on multiple occasions. 

Since 2006, Hunter x Hunter has gone on numerous lengthy hiatuses due to varying reasons, Including but not limited to: Togashi's struggle with Lumbago, exhaustion, and his mental health. His physical and mental health was also a leading cause in the premature conclusion of Yu Yu Hakusho.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ToshiSahashi)

__Toshihiko Sahashi__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music in 1986. Sahashi has composed music for various anime series (including OVAs, films, and drama CDs), video games, films, dramas, and musicals.

The style of his composition is richly symphonic and classical (occasionally jazz). The use of sophisticated compositional techniques, as well as complicated harmony writing such as fugue can often be heard in his work, demonstrating his solid training in the western classical music. He also uses keyboard instruments to deliver more sentimental soundtracks to good effect.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/numa_milky)

Numata is best known for his strongly distorted character style and peculiar sense for timing, often being named as an animator of the [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) school. He tends to work together with character designer [Kyuuta Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/106111/), whose disproportionated character designs particularly fit his style, employing often large teardrops, which brought him to spotlight in [Higurashi no Naku Koro ni](https://anilist.co/anime/934/). The duo also participated together in several other shows, such as [Ichigo Mashimaro](https://anilist.co/anime/488/) and [Strawberry Panic](https://anilist.co/anime/855/).

Every now and then works under one of his many pseudonyms.

(Source: Anidb)
He is a scriptwriter and novelist.
He is a scriptwriter and novelist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/遠藤重夫)

Joined Nippon Animation in 1973. After some desk work he got promoted to a producer on [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/)'s directorial debut, [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/). Following this he took part in the production of World Masterpiece Theater serials.
Michio Katou is an animation planner and producer.
